intro: Gerardia edwardsiana, commonly known as the Edwards' gerardia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in the spring and summer seasons. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Gerardia edwardsiana is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
